lines.text: Why do your people have such long names?
I don't know. Perhaps it's because we all have such short lives.
This is a rough go, huh, Cassie?
Yeah. If I stay here any longer, I'll end up in jail.
Wouldn't you rather blow one up?
For money or for laughs?
About as much as you'd make in a year - a hundred dollars. Not many laughs.
[the one-armed Slater explains his situation]
I'm a freak, Keno. Half man and half gun. Why, I can't whip a six-year-old girl in a fair fight, but I can blow a man's eyeballs out at a hundred yards - in a sandstorm.
You know, it takes a man my age to appreciate a real woman. She's worth it, too.
Oh, I appreciate them, Levi. Every one I've ever had. I just appreciated the hell out of 'em!
I'm a one-armed gunney.
Could be worse... you could be a one-armed *black* gunney.
You were married? What happened?
She found a whole man.
I guess that makes her half a woman. You're better off without her.
[first lines]
Where is the meeting?
In the church.
Is Quintero with them?
Yes.
And what about Lobero?
He is a bandit and a thief.
But it is hard to respect the law when you feel the heel of its boot on your back.
I'm not so sure that what Lobero wants for the revolution is the same as what we want.
He says he wants to help and he has many guns.
Do you trust him?

[shakes his head]
Only his guns.
For the revolution, I would make a bargain with the devil, so why not with Lobero?
You want to know my name before you hang me?
Not particularly. Just your last words.
I demand a recount.
Stealin' a man's horse in this country is worse than stealin' a man's wife. There's been too much of that goin' on recently and I'm going to put a stop to it.
Horse stealing or wife stealing?
Anybody in favor of hanging this man, say "Aye."
Aye!
Against?
Nooo.
And who says, "No"?
Me.
Just who are you to say, "No"?
Who do you have to be to say "No" to a rigged court - stretchin' the neck of this poor slob?
I need help - more men.
We have the men - quick with the guns, but slow with the brains.
Six men - not enough to attract suspicion - just enough to do the job.
Chris, can I fight with you? Oh, it's not for the money - I could not take it. It's for Quintero.
Not on the basis of what you did against Keno.
I'm young, I'm strong, I'm angry and I will learn. Besides, my cousin says seven is a lucky number for you.
Chris, how old do you have to be to die?
[last lines]
Max, what did Chris say?
He said, "A coward dies many deaths... the brave only one."

[referring to Lobero]
A pig with armor is still but a pig.

[putting a lit cigar to Lobero's face]
If you move any way but back you're gonna lose that eye.
